author: Special Correspondent
text:
As the Speaker refused permission to raise the issue of government employees’ strike, the Opposition parties staged a walkout at the Assembly on Wednesday.

Immediately after the question hour, DMK deputy leader of the House Durai Murugan began to speak.

As soon as he mentioned the words “government servants,” Speaker P. Dhanapal told him to stop.

Promising to take up the issue later, he asked Mr. Durai Murugan to sit, who argued that it was a major issue involving lakhs of government staff.

Unrelenting, the Speaker said the DMK could talk take it up during the discussion on the budget. By now, the DMDK MLAs were also on their feet asking the Speaker to take up the issue. Mr. Durai Murugan said that the MLAs were coming to the Assembly only to raise such important issues. Some of the DMK MLAs had, by now, come near the Chair.

However, the Speaker did not allow any debate on the issue and asked the MLAs to go back to their seats.

The CPI(M) and CPI MLAs also stood up and demanded that their views be recorded at least.

As the Speaker did not budge and informed the House that no one could impose anything on him, the DMK MLAs and the DMDK MLAs staged a walkout.

Soon the Left parties also walked out.
title: Oppn. stages walkout over govt. staff strike
